paragraphs.content: The inclination towards experimentation and artistic research led him from the outset to explore various unconventional musical styles. Improvisation, inter-actions, blends of electronic and acoustic sounds, polyrhythmicexplorations, interdisciplinary forays into science and art are common features of his works.

Born in the countryside of Alessandria [Italy] into a family rich in musicians, he initially approached music during his childhood (initially the violin, later the electric bass and double bass) and established a very close connection with ecosystems and their elements.

In 2016, he graduated cum laude with a thesis on Kaleidophone and Thesaurus at the Conservatorio of Alessandria. Driven by a strong passion for the natural world, in 2018, he earned a degree cum laude in biology, focusing on the ecological impact of allochthonous species. In 2020, he completed his two-year program at the Conservatory of Piacenza with his work Cross-Rhythms. These works form the basis for the development of his artistic research, leading him to win a scholarship for AReMus, a second-level Post-Graduate Master’s program held in the Conservatory Santa Cecilia in Rome in 2022. In 2023, he was selected for the PhD program in artistic research at the Conservatory Santa Cecilia and University of RomaTre.

Currently, his work focuses on the interrelations between electro-acoustic improvisation and cultural/natural ecology. The output of this project includes a photographic-musical album called [insita], released on September 18, 2023, with the label nusica.org, and a series of site-specific improvisation performances, [in situ], taking place from 2023 to 2025, where environmental sounds are integrated into the compositional and improvisational process.
Leonardo Barbierato, «[in situ]: re-thinking the role of music improvisation performance in the context of ecological crisis”, RUUKKU, 2024.
